tr.td: Title:MCAO Astrometry of WISE Y dwarfs
Co-I(s): Chris Gelino, Jackie Faherty, Daniela Opitz

body.div: The NASA WISE satellite has delivered an unparalleled harvest of new ultra-cool Y-type brown dwarfs. It has more than fulfilled its key goal of detecting the coldest of brown dwarfs, at effective temperatures of less than 500K. We propose to exploit the capabilities of the Gemini MCAO system to obtain diffraction- limited, wide-field data on these targets for both measurements of their binary fraction and astrometric measurements of their distances.

ul.li: [data] [ADS] Searching for Binary Y Dwarfs with the Gemini Multi-conjugate Adaptive Optics System (GeMS)
